text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HAARETZ
- United States: Israel must show much greater flexibility in two coming redeployments.
- Legislative initiative: 61 lawmakers can depose prime minister without disbanding parliament.
- Doctors will stop releasing patients in protest against distress in hospitals.
- Treasury will delay funds and take steps against those responsible for public sector wage irregularities.
- Field officer: no need to change rules for flying soldiers in helicopters.
JERUSALEM POST
- United States pledged support for nine percent pullback.
- Prime Minister Netanyahu meets lawmakers in coalition crisis.
- Arabs press for Har Homa debate in U.N. General Assembly.
- Police hope Bar-On probe in final week.
- Uzbekistan opens embassy in Tel Aviv.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Fear for coalition stability: eight lawmakers threaten to break away. Netanyahu threatens rebels with "unity" government.
- Foreign Minister Levy to testify today in attorney-general affair.
- Average wage in economy: 4,847 shekels per month ($1,470).
MAARIV
- Protest in coalition widens.
- Israel thanks United States for veto.
